title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Labor will consider adopting the federal government's climate change target in a bid to lift support in working-class and regional areas. Shadow resources Minister Joel Fitzgibbon will use a speech in Sydney on Wednesday night to call on his colleagues to endorse the Coalition's 2030 emissions reduction target. Mr Fitzgibbon is expected to argue the party should aim to reduce carbon emissions by 28 per cent of 2005 levels within 11 years. Former Opposition Leader Bill Shorten took a 45 per cent target to the May election. Image: Getty
